title: draft/unposted messages are deleted from the message input field when a user navigates away from the messaging screen

milestone.description:
**1. Finish anything that wasn't completed in the previous 0.14 cycle**

- And fix bugs as usual. We need to keep tech. debt at a roughly fixed level as we grow out functionality, can't let it accumulate! ;-)

**2. Complete initial airdrop functionality**
- Airdrop history screens
- Ability to airdrop based on in-Community activity (No. of msg, No. msg in time range, joining a community, length of community membership)  Ability to combine multiple attributes into an airdrop
- Ability to token gate airdrops
- Live airdrop gas estimation when setting up airdrop

**3. Token import functionality**
- Ability for a community Owner to import ERC-20 and NFT tokens, to later be airdropped or retailed

**4. Admin functionality enhancements**
- Ability to mark a token gated channel as 'hidden', only visible to community members with the requisite tokens
- optional service to once a month auto-kick all members who haven't been online for between 30 and 60 days (e.g. auto-kick members whose profile information like Name, Avatar, etc... can no longer be fetched)

**5. QR scanner**
- Needed for private key transfer
- Ethereum key QRs (send modal triggered)
- User Share URL in a QR (opens user profile dialogue) 
- Community and Channel inside Community URL in QRs (takes user to Community or Channel in Community)

**6. Chat functionality enhancements**
- Introduce @channel as a new type of global @ mention.  This @ mention only @ mention's everyone who has posted a message in a channel in the last 30 days 

**7. Binaries over Waku**
- Improve transfer of binaries over waku via splitting into chunks https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/9923
- Posting of small files (max size somewhere in the region of 1 to 2mb).  Requires above item before going live


**--- Wallet Team ---**

1. Total balance graphs for 'All accounts' and each individual account

2. Advanced transaction signing

body:
Version: 0.9
OS: Windows 10

**Related issue:** This issue is expanding on issue #9304 

When a user writes a message in the message input field and then navigates away from that screen, upon returning, the unposted message is no longer in the input field and has been lost. 

**Desired behaviour:** Anything that has been entered into the message input field should remain in that field until it is posted or for the duration of that session. So if a user starts writing a message, navigates somewhere else and later returns to where they were writing the message, the un-posted message should still be in the message input field. 

***

## Scenario 1 - message input box persistence in community channels

<ins>Steps to reproduce:</ins>

1. Navigate to any community channel screen that contains a message input field. 

2. Type a message into the message input field, but do not post the message 

3. Navigate away from that messaging screen to anywhere else in the app 

4. Return to the community channel you were in in step 2.  

<ins>What currently incorrectly happens:</ins>

5. The message copy written in the message input field in step 2. has disappeared

<ins>What is supposed to happen:</ins>

5. The message copy written in the message input field in step 2. should stay in the message input field until the user either posts the message, deletes the message, or exits the status app (current session ends)

<ins>Other information</ins>




https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/124154641/222219042-afb1f43f-c5dc-472a-9be3-4219558e93e5.mp4





 

## Scenario 2 - message input box persistence in 1on1 and ad-hoc group chat threads

<ins>Steps to reproduce:</ins>

1. Navigate to a 1on1 or ad-hoc group chat message thread

2. Type a message into the message input field, but do not post the message 

3. Navigate away from this messaging screen to a different **1on1 or ad-hoc group chat thread**.

4. Return to the messaging thread that you were in in step 2.

<ins>What currently incorrectly happens:</ins>

5.  The message copy written in the message input field in step 2. has disappeared.

<ins>What is supposed to happen:</ins>
 
5. The message copy written in the message input field in step 2. should stay in the message input field until the user either posts the message, deletes the message, or exits the status app (current session ends)

<ins>Other information</ins>

If in step 3. if a user navigates to anywhere else in the app **other than to a different 1on1 or ad-hoc message**, when the user returns to the original message thread, the message copy  correctly remains persisted in the message input field.

 


https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/124154641/222218270-2d5a8b0b-788c-4cb3-9ca6-0e63fbe6c9a4.mp4

Related to https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/9235

> @caybro Not much.
> For the fix - we need to disable unloading the ChatLayout from the loader when we switch between the sections. For this purposes, we remove changing `active` for Chat section and for Community section... and here is where the magic comes:
> If you'll start switching between Chat or community sections - ChatLayout does not update its content, while StackLayout index is changing
> 

Then you have to activate it manually, not via the binding. Look at the git history how it used to be done before

@caybro I did it. 
Let me show you a small example:
For minimizing the test, commented chat section + I have 3 communities with different channel names and members. Community is created and not unloading on an application startup... look at switching between the section - title, and members count is changing, all other - no. So stack layout is switching but the content is showing from the previous community section. That's the main problem I have not solved.

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/117639195/224801853-3c9290da-a759-483b-a34c-27a0063e3f0e.mov

Thank you, @caybro 
In my case I do not want to re-execute it, it should already keep the necessary chatCommunitySectionModule after the loading.
At least I found the problem.
The problem was here
```
rootStore.chatCommunitySectionModule = 
  appMain.rootStore.mainModuleInst.getCommunitySectionModule()
```
where 
`rootStore: rootChatStore`
so all our RootStore for the Chat and Community sections had the same RootStore and we just rewrote `chatCommunitySectionModule` during the loader load, which is wrong. Each chat and community must have their own instance of `chatCommunitySectionModule` or `rootStore`
